item.title: China’s Xi, Now Alone Atop His Military, Is the Sole Voice in Tackling Taiwan
item.description: Purges of top generals means China’s leader has a freer hand to deal with the self-ruled island that Beijing claims as its own.

item.title: China Agrees to Lower Tariffs by Half on U.K. Whisky
item.description: The U.K. government said it expects whisky exports to China to be worth roughly $345.2 million to the economy over the next five years as tariffs are lowered to 5% from 10%.

item.title: China Approves Purchases of Nvidia’s H200 Chip, Easing Tension With U.S.
item.description: Beijing gave the green light to Alibaba and others, but is keeping in place limits intended to encourage purchases of local chips.

item.title: China Imports to Help Lower U.K. Inflation to Target, BOE’s Taylor Says
item.description: The annual rate of inflation is likely to fall to the Bank of England’s 2% target by the middle of this year, aided by cheap imports from China, the rate-setter said.

item.title: Opinion | China Loses a Foothold in Panama
item.description: A court ruling should put to rest Trump’s claim that China is running the canal.

item.title: China Manufacturing Gauge Shows Pickup in Activity
item.description: A private gauge of China’s manufacturing sector showed factories continued to expand activity in January.

item.title: Why China Cares About Being Cool All of a Sudden
item.description: The soft-power image makers in Beijing ride plushy dolls and YouTube influencers to win hearts abroad

item.title: China’s Manufacturing PMI Contracts in January
item.description: China’s official gauges of factory, services and construction activity unexpectedly slipped into contraction at the start of 2026, signaling a cooling in economic growth.

item.title: U.K.’s Starmer Joins Ranks of U.S. Allies Testing China’s Embrace
item.description: In a visit to Beijing, the British leader is seeking to rekindle ties with Xi Jinping, with a business delegation in tow.

item.title: China’s Local Governments Cut Growth Targets
item.description: More than a dozen Chinese provinces have cut their growth targets for the year, stoking speculation that Beijing will follow suit and set a lower national goal for 2026.

item.title: South Africa Risks Angering Trump by Hosting Navies of Iran, Russia, China
item.description: The military exercises come at a time of already strained relations with the U.S.

item.title: India Is on a Himalayan Building Spree to Prepare for a Clash With China
item.description: A deadly standoff jolted India to stitch together a huge network of roads, tunnels and landing strips needed to move soldiers and supplies to the mountainous border region.

item.title: Chinese Man Who Documented Uyghur Population Is Granted U.S. Asylum
item.description: The citizen-journalist, Heng Guan, drew attention after he was detained by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

item.title: The Deflation Doom Loop Trapping China’s Economy
item.description: Exports drive growth while race-to-the-bottom competition from overproduction hits prices, profits, wages and sales.
